function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Subjective evaluations of indoor environments by occupants may not align with objective measures, leading to discrepancies in assessing indoor environmental quality.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of indoor environmental quality can lead to suboptimal building design and maintenance, potentially affecting occupant health and performance.","Mitigation":"Implement a comprehensive approach that combines subjective evaluations with objective, instrumental measures to obtain a holistic understanding of indoor environmental quality.","Technologies":"Advanced sensor technologies, data analytics, and building performance simulation tools can be used to integrate objective and subjective measures for accurate assessment.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, building designers, researchers","Owner":"Facility managers, building designers, researchers"},{"Description":"Narrow control clauses in commercial office tenancy agreements may lead to suboptimal indoor temperature management, potentially impacting occupant comfort and energy efficiency.","Impact":"Inflexible temperature control measures may result in discomfort for occupants and unnecessary energy consumption, leading to increased environmental and climate impacts.","Mitigation":"Adopt adaptive temperature control strategies based on occupant preferences and behavior, and align indoor temperature setpoints with international thermal comfort standards.","Technologies":"Smart building automation systems, occupancy sensors, and adaptive control algorithms can enable dynamic temperature management while maintaining occupant comfort and energy efficiency.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, building owners, energy managers","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, energy managers"},{"Description":"High energy expenditure during the operational phase of buildings and non-compliance with energy efficiency standards can lead to significant environmental and climate impacts.","Impact":"Increased energy consumption contributes to higher greenhouse gas emissions and environmental degradation, exacerbating the global climate crisis.","Mitigation":"Implement energy-efficient building design and retrofit measures, adhere to international energy efficiency standards, and prioritize renewable energy sources to reduce environmental and climate impacts.","Technologies":"Building energy simulation software, energy-efficient HVAC systems, renewable energy technologies, and monitoring tools for energy performance optimization.","People":"Building owners, energy managers, environmental regulators, policymakers","Owner":"Building owners, energy managers, environmental regulators"}]}
